title: Banners: Verify a CMS Banner can be added to app screens
custom_preconds: Given banners have been setup in QA/PROD HomeBase

custom_steps_separated.content: When a banner is set up to display on the Scoreboard (iPhone: 320x50, iPad: 970x90)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the banner ad that was configured will display on the Scoreboard

custom_steps_separated.content: When a banner is set up to display on the Teams view (320x50)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the banner ad that was configured will display on the Teams view

custom_steps_separated.content: When a banner is set up to display on the MILB.TV EPG (320x50)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the banner ad that was configured will display on the MILB.TV EPG

title: Banners: Test a Banner that isn't closeable
custom_preconds:
Given we have Developer assistance
And the Developer has setup the unclose-able banner
custom_expected:
Then we should see the banner
And we shouldn't be able to close the banner

title: Banners: Test a Banner that is closeable.
custom_preconds:
Given we have Developer assistance
And the Developer has added a banner that can be closed
custom_expected:
Then we can see the Banner
And if we close the Banner it will not be visible again

title: Banners: Banners of different heights can be configured on the server side
custom_preconds:
Given we have Developer assistance
And the Developer has configured banners of different heights
custom_expected: Then we can see the banners of different heights

title: Banners: Verify an Ad Banner can open an internal webview
custom_preconds:
Given we have a Developer has setup the banner
And the banner is hyper-linked to a URL that should be open in an internal webview
custom_steps: When we tap on the banner
custom_expected:
Then Safari will NOT launch
And the user will see the webview open in an internal view 
And the user will be able to easily navigate back to the app

title: Banners: Verify an Ad Banner can open an external webview
custom_preconds:
Given we have a Developer has setup the banner
And the banner is hyper-linked to a URL that should be open in an external webview
custom_steps: When we tap on the banner
custom_expected:
Then Safari will launch
And the user will see the webview open in an external view
And the user will have to background the webview to return to the app manually

title: Banners: Verify an Ad Banner can launch a video stream
custom_preconds:
Given we have a Developer has setup the banner
And the banner is linked to a video stream
custom_steps: When we tap on the banner
custom_expected:
Then the video will launch using the native media player
And the stream will play without issue

title: Banners: Verify an Ad Banner can be removed
custom_preconds:
Given we have Developer assistance
And the Developer has removed the banner
custom_expected: Then the banner should be removed from the location it was previously showing at

title: Banners/Ads: Verify an AdMarvel Banner can be added to app screens
custom_preconds: Given AdMarvel ads are enabled and set up by Ad Ops

custom_steps_separated.content: When a banner is set up to display on the Scoreboard (iPhone: 320x50, iPad: 970x90)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the banner ad that was configured will display on the Scoreboard

custom_steps_separated.content: When a banner is set up to display on the Teams view (320x50, iPad: 970x90)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the banner ad that was configured will display on the Teams view

custom_steps_separated.content: When a banner is set up to display on the News tab (320x50, iPad: 970x90)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the banner ad that was configured will display on the News tab

custom_steps_separated.content: When a banner is set up to display on the News Article view (300x250)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the ad that was configured will display under the 3rd paragraph of the article

custom_steps_separated.content: When a banner is set up to display on the News Index view (300x250)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the ad that was configured will display every 2 news articles

custom_steps_separated.content: When a banner is set up to display on the iPad News Index view (970x90)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the banner ad that was configured will display on the News index

title: Banners/Ads: Verify an Ad Banner can be removed
custom_preconds:
Given we have Developer assistance
And the Developer has removed the banner
custom_expected: Then the banner should be removed from the location it was previously showing at

title: Banners/Ads: Verify an Ad Banner can open an external webview
custom_preconds:
Given we have a Developer has setup the banner
And the banner is hyper-linked to a URL that should be open in an external webview
custom_steps: When we tap on the banner
custom_expected:
Then Safari will launch
And the user will see the webview open in an external view
And the user will have to background the webview to return to the app manually

title: Banners/Ads: Verify we have the ability to target Ad Marvel ads
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed First Pitch
AND we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to News
AND we target ads to the feature of Lite users
OR we target ads to the feature of Premium users
custom_expected: THEN we are able to successfully target specific ads to each of the feature types

title: Banners/Ads: Verify an AdMarvel banner can launch the MiLB.TV Paywall
Notifications: After closing out of a notification when a new one is created then that one is received by the device
custom_preconds:
Given we have Developer assistance
And we have closed a popup
And the Developer has created another popup
custom_expected: Then the new popup is received

title: Pop-up Notifications: Popups will have a button that can close it
custom_preconds:
Given we have Developer assistance
And the Developer has created a popup with a button

title: Pop-Up Notifications: Popups that have a button linked to an internal web page will open that web page
custom_preconds:
Given we have Developer assistance
And the Developer has created a multi-button popup
And the Developer has linked one of the buttons to a web page
custom_steps: When clicking the button linked to an internal web page
custom_expected: Then the web page opens in an internal view

title: Pop-Up Notifications: Popups that have a button linked to an external web page will open that web page
custom_preconds:
Given we have Developer assistance
And the Developer has created a multi-button popup
And the Developer has linked one of the buttons to a web page
custom_steps: When clicking the button linked to an external web page
custom_expected: Then the web page opens in an external view (safari browser)

title: Banner Notification: In-App banner that is linked to an web page will open that web page
custom_preconds:
Given we have Developer assistance
And the Developer has created a banner notification
And the Developer has linked the banner to a web page
custom_steps: When clicking the banner linked to an web page

title: Banner Notification: default display time
custom_preconds:
Given we have Developer assistance
And the Developer has created a banner notification
And the Developer has used the default displayTime
custom_steps: When the banner appears in the app
custom_expected:
Then the banner will only show for 5 seconds
And the banner will dismiss
And the banner will not appear again in the same session

title: Banner Notification: non-default display time
custom_preconds:
Given we have Developer assistance
And the Developer has created a banner notification
And the Developer has used a non-default displayTime (example 30 seconds)
custom_steps: When the banner appears in the app
custom_expected:
Then the banner will only show for the set displayTime
And the banner will dismiss
And the banner will not appear again in the same session

title: Banner Notification: requires user dismissal with close button
custom_preconds:
Given we have Developer assistance
And the Developer has created a banner notification
And the Developer has used set up the notification banner to require user interaction to close
And the Developer has added a close button to the notification banner
custom_steps: When the banner appears in the app
custom_expected:
Then the banner will show with a close button
And the banner will not dismiss unless the user taps the close button to dismiss the banner
And the banner will not appear again in the same session
